item.title: Getting my server online
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Jake2008, post:3, topic:393855”]hi thanks for the reply, i found this earlier in client.java and edited it to my I.p address:[quote] }

public int GetWorld(int PlayerID) {
String Server = PlayerHandler.players[PlayerID].playerServer;

	if (Server.equals("My I.P") || Server.equals("localhost")) {
		return 1;
	} else {

		return 1; // 0; friendlist fix-bakatool
	}
}[/quote]

It still didn’t work but thanks for the reply. however i didnt save it as a .class file this time[/quote]you have to edit the .java file and compile. without it saving into the .class file it will not read it.

item.title: Getting my server online
item.dc:creator: @Jake2008 Jake2008
item.description:
@Jake2008 wrote:

Okay, so I’ve been messing around with a server source for a while, and I want to get it online so I can mess around with my some friends and try to update the server to their oppinions.

This is also somthing i want to know how to do before i consider using a VPS.

To some of you this will seem like a pointless post but heres my problem:

I have a server file, and a client file; I want to be able to connect to myself but not by connecting to “0.0.0.0”.
so heres what I’ve done so far.

This is my port forward settings, I’ve used my straight i.p I havn’t used no-ip or anything like that as I will be trusting the people I allow on this server, hopefully this is not a problem.

I have then went to the Client folder and opened a a file called GUI.java

public static void main(String args[]) { new Gui(args); 
}

private Gui(String args[]) 
{
	super();
		try {

		Serverip = "I  put my Ip address here";
		sign.signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getByName(Serverip));
		initUI();
	} 
	catch(Exception ex)
	{
		ex.printStackTrace();
	}
}</blockquote>

I then tried saving it as Gui.java and this did not work so i saved it as the GUI.Class aswell, and it still did not work. i have backup copys so there is no big issue but if you can let me know if i should save as .java and .class or .java that would help a lot:P

Well thats pretty much my attempts and after doing this it has not worked yet. Maybe there is somthing I need to change in the server folder, please let me know.

thanks for viewing my thread:) I’ve tried to include all the information i can to help.

Read full topic
